Syntax: cast 'sunburst' Area of Effect: Room Aggressive: Yes Cumulative: N/A Duration: Dependent on proficiency of caster Type of spell: Elemental
The "sunburst" spell calls down the power of the sun to affect multiple targets, who are struck by a beam of pure light. This spell can seriously disorient the caster's foes, stunning them so that they cannot move or react in any way.

Spell
Syntax: cast 'sunray' <target> Area of Effect: Single target, In-Room Aggressive: Yes Cumulative: N/A Duration: Instant Type of spell: Summoning
A successful sunray causes the power of the sun to be focused at one target, who is engulfed in a powerful beam of light. This spell does a lot of damage to the target, who has a chance to be blinded as well.

Spell
Syntax: cast 'sustenance' <target> Area of effect: Single target, In-Room Aggressive: No Cumulative: N/A Duration: Instant Type of spell: Spiritual
Sustenance causes the target's hunger (and to a lesser extent, thirst) to be sated for a time. As the caster's abilities improve, both the amount sated and the max allowable increases.
This spell will also cancel the effects of "famine" caused by the spell "apocalypse".

Reflexive Skill
The swimming skill allows a character to move while in (or below) a body of water.
Traversing through water requires a large amount of effort. Having a high swim skill can reduce the amount of stamina required greatly. A skilled swimmer can travel more than twice as far as a beginner without getting too tired to move.
You can 'SWIM UP', 'SWIM DOWN', or 'SWIM SURFACE'.

Switch opponent allows the player to switch targets during battle. Switch opponent is a level-dependant skill that has to be used to be improved. The skill can and will fail, causing the user to become momentarily disoriented and confused.

A "tank" is the player who is engaged in direct combat with a mob or player. The tank takes the physical damage given out by the mob or players attacks. Other players in the room may take magical damage from the opponent of the tank. The tank usually gets extra experience from being the tank.

This spell hits the target with a sudden and violent burst of force, which can slam the target against walls or throw them out of the room entirely.

THAC0 stands for "to-hit armor class zero". It's a number that represents how much chance you have to hit a character or person with an armor class equal to zero (the mid-point between +100 AC and -100 AC).
The lower your THAC0, the better chance you have of hitting.
Your class, level, equipment, and various other status effects can improve or hinder your ability to hit your opponent.

Rogue sub-class
Thieves are rogues, stealing and killing to make a living. They're the masters of picking locks, finding traps, and stealing from friend and foe alike. Thieves prefer to skulk in the shadows during combat, waiting for the opportunity to stab someone in the back. They have some abilities that allow them to fight head-to-head, but against a properly trained and equipped warrior, they probably don't stand a chance.
Important Attributes: Strength, Dexterity, Agility
Races: Human, Grey Elf, Halfling, Mountain Dwarf, Half-Elf, Githzerai, Orc Duergar, Githyanki, Flind, Rakshasa
Equipment: Thieves are rogues, and can use most weapons. Their choice of armor is more limited, however, since heavy armor makes sneaking in shadows impossible.

The need for water is not something you can ignore. Thirst is much like hunger in that it needs to be satisfied. If you neglect to drink water you will start to lose hps and regenerate movement and hitpoints more slowly.
Thirst for casters can be very harsh because you cannot memorize, pray or cast spells with a parched throat.
Make sure to drink. There are many fountains throughout the game where free water is offered.

Thri-Kreen are very vulnerable to cold.

Throat crush is just that. The mercenary punches the opponent in the throat. This offers both an extra attack and, in the cast of casters or bards, can prevent the opponent from casting spells.

Titles can only be given out by administrators or by guild leaders for people in their guilds. Titles may contain color codes, but can only be of a certain length (around 50 characters or so).
You must be level 35 or greater to request a title from an administrator.
All titles must be "appropriate", which means they should be fantasy-related, should not contain bad language, and they cannot contain misleading information about race, class, guild, etc. "Last names" for characters are considered appropriate, if they fit in with the fantasy theme.
If you are in a guild and have a title, your title must be short enough so that your guild name can be plainly seen in the WHO.

Totems are required by shamans to cast their spells, as they allow them to focus their energies into magic.
Shaman spells are divided into "spheres" - animal, elemental, and spiritual. Lesser totems are used to cast spells in a certain sphere below 6th circle, while greater totems are used to cast those spells 6th and over. Totems can also grant more than one sphere or high/low-level spells. Totems must be held while casting (but not required during memming).
Higher totems can be bought at various shaman-related stores around the mud.

Spells
Syntax: cast 'touch of nightshade' <target> Area of Effect: Single target, Touch Aggressive: Yes Cumulative: N/A Duration: Instant Type of spell: Elemental
This spell calls upon the forces of nature to afflict a single target with a sudden burst of pain, such as that one would get after ingesting horrible poison. The effects of the spell are sudden and brutal, and leaves the target moderately injured.

Applied Skill
Aggressive: No
Track is a skill used by rangers to locate another person or mob in a zone. Tracking will lead the ranger to the target by following the tell-tale signs left by the footprints. Tracking does not work on the map. Tracking becomes quite difficult if the target is moving around excessively.

TRANSFER transfers the target character, or ALL player characters, to your current location (default) or to a specified location.

This spell transfers some life from the caster to the target. At lower levels, the caster will lose a large amount more than the target gains, whereas at higher levels, it will even out.

Applied skill:
Syntax: trip (only used in battle) Aggressive: yes
Trip is a skill used by thieves and assassins to gain an unfair advantage over their opponents. Trip takes the opponent off their feet where they will take an extra amount of damage. A failed trip will put the aggressor on their back where they will take the damage.
Size does matter! One may trip a level larger and also an opponent of the same size, but trip will not work on a smaller opponent.

This skill represents the character's ability to make quicker attacks. The highter the proficiency one has in this skill, the more likely that character is to gain an additional attack during a combat round.

Trolls are an ugly race, tall and wiry and possessing enormous strength. They vary in coloration from pale greens to dark browns and blacks, and stand much taller than a human.
Trolls are known as being greedy and vicious, living together in warbands in a clannish society where the only the strong survive.
Trolls have the ability to regenerate damage at an incredible rate, and possess ultravision.
Class list: Warrior, Mercenary, Shaman
Stats: Quite strong and durable, trolls are cursed with stupidity and lack of wisdom. They're very quick for their size, which has surprised more than one of their victims.
STR: Excellent INT: Very Poor DEX: Below Average WIS: Poor AGI: Average CHA: Pathetic CON: Very Good
Size: Large Innate abilities: Ultravision, Bodyslam (for warriors and mercenaries), Doorbash, Regeneration Weakness: Trolls are susceptible to fire moreso than any other player race. Hometown: Bloodrock

Spell
Syntax: cast 'true seeing' Area of Effect: Self Aggressive: No Cumulative: N/A Duration: Dependant on proficiency of caster Type of spell: Divination
This spell will allow the caster's vision to be dramatically enhanced. He will be able to see invisible and hidden items, detect alignments, and detect the aura of magic about equipment.

TRUST sets a character's trust to the specified level. This is similar to advancing the character for accessing immortal commands, but has no effect on combat strength, et cetera. You can give more trust to mortal (or immortal) characters to give them access to more power without messing up the character. You can also restrict a player's trust to less than their natural level.
A trust of 0 means to use the character's natural level again.

Depending on the proficiency of the caster, this spell can cause undead in the room to flee in terror or inflict great damage upon them.

Spell

Between the light of day and the darkness of night is the twilight. This spell mimics this natural cycle by negating continual light or darkness spells, bathing a room in twilight.

Innate
Some races enjoy the ability to see in pure darkness. Ultravision allows one to view objects, creatures or players in total darkness by channeling specific wavelengths of light. This night vision ability is quite common with the races that dwell in total darkness, such as the Underdark. However, players and creatures with Ultravision tend to be very prone to bright illumination.

Applied Skill
This skill determines the ability of a character to dish out damage to a target while using nothing but his bare hands. It is used in conjunction with the skill barehanded fighting, which determines the chance of hitting a target.

Spell

This spell calls down the wrath of the gods on those of good alignment. It does a great deal of damage and can cause instant death, major paralysis, blindness, or stunning, depending on the differences between the levels of the caster and his target.
If a person of good alignment casts this spell, it can have deadly side effects.

VALUE will let you know how much a shopkeeper is willing to pay for an item you have. If no shopkeeper is given, the first shopkeeper in the room will be chosen.
VALUE, as well as most object manipulation commands, allows the use of the #.object format, where # is a number or the word "all". This allows a player to choose a specific item from a group of items with the same keywords.
For example, if the command "LIST DAGGER" showed you that a shopkeeper had five daggers, you could type "BUY 3.DAGGER".
Make sure you include the period between the number of the item and the name. If you used a space in the above example instead of a period, you would attempt to buy three daggers, not the third dagger.
Prices in shops can be affected by a player's charisma.

Innate Anti-Paladin [Level 1]
Area of Effect: Self Aggressive: N/A Cumulative: No Duration: Permanent for the innate ability Dependent on the proficiency of the caster for the spell Type of Spell: Necromancy
The magic of this spell or ability will cause the caster or anti-paladin's hands to leech a portion of the target's lifeforce, giving the caster health. The caster must be barehanded for this magic to work since he must be able to touch the victim.

This spell creates an illusion of a person speaking. The person targeted by this spell will appear to say the message given by the caster.
This may be the single most useless spell in the game.

This spell restores some movement points to a target, letting him travel onwards. The amount of movement restored is dependent on the version of the spell cast. "Vigorize serious" is less powerful than "vigorize critical" but more powerful than "vigorize light".

VISIBILITY without any arguments will inform you of your current visibility status. It will let you know if you are invisible or not.
Any other argument to the visibility command will snap you out of invisibility or hiding.

Spell
Syntax: cast 'vitality' <target> Area of Effect: Single target, In-Room Aggressive: No Cumulative: No, but renewable Duration: Dependent on proficiency of caster Type of spell: Enchantment
This spell increases the maximum health levels of the target by an amount of points dependant on the level of the caster and the natural hit points of the target.
Once this spell runs out, the target loses the health that he gained because of the spell. If this drop causes the target to go below zero hit points, he will die.

Wait states is a mechanism in which we count the delay between your actions. Commands such like casting, kicking, walking, disarming, brandishing, zapping, quaffing, etc cause a certain delay before your next action can go through. This represents the amount of time you need in order to complete the action.
You may also accumulate a delay when a certain action is performed upon you. These actions are being tripped, disarmed, etc.
If you are in combat, it is wise to use your wait state level as an indicator as to when your next command will go through. Should you have a wait state greater than 0, all your other typed commands will be queued until your wait returns to 0.

WAKE with no target will attempt to awaken yourself if you fell asleep. WAKE followed by a target name will attempt to awaken that person.
Waking will not change your position. You may have to use the ALERT command to stop relaxing after your nap.

Fighter sub-class
Warriors excel in hand to hand combat, living for the thrill of bloody, close-combat melees. They are trained specifically for fighting and have combat skills that other classes cannot match.
Warriors excel in rescueing, kicking, and parrying. They are the only class that gains the fourth attack skill at high levels. In addition, they also are the only class that gets the guard skill. Warriors tend to be the front line shock troops, since they generally have the highest hitpoints of any other class.
Important Attributes: Strength, Constitution, Dexterity, Agility
Races: All Races
Equipment: Warriors can use almost all weapons and armor. They are limited in the types of magical items such as wands, staves, or scrolls.
Innate Abilities: None

Attribute
Wisdom is a measure of many things: judgement, enlightenment, willpower, and intuition. It represents the planning ability of a character and his ability to learn from experience. It is the primary attribute of all priestly classes and is a benefit to all other classes as well, since it impacts the speed at which one can learn.
Some races naturally are more wise than others. The mountain dwarves and their duergar enemies are counted as some of the wisests of the races, because of their long lifespan and the methods by which they hand down information from generation to generation. Ogres and barbarians are considered to be the most unwise.

HOLD will allow you to take a piece of equipment from your inventory and hold it in one of your hands. It is normally used for light sources, wands, staves, and the like.

For example, if you had 2 spellbooks and wanted to hold the second one, you would type:
hold 2.spellbook

The ISSUE command lets you view and manage issues in the MUD's issue database.
Issues are created in a few different ways:
- Players can create them with the 'bug' command. - Players can create them with the 'typo' command. - Players can create them with the 'requesthelp' command. - Immortals can create them using the 'issue' command.
The following things can be done with the ISSUE command:
'issue' lists the currently open issues. 'issue show <number>' shows the details of a specific issue number. 'issue update <number> <text>' updates the specified issue number with the supplied note. The issue remains open. 'issue close <number> <text>' updates the specified issue number with the supplied note and closes it. 'issue priority <number> <lowest|low|medium|high|highest>' changes the priority level of an issue. 'issue add <text>' creates an issue with the supplied description. 'issue create <text>' same as above.

Neogi are a race of creatures that resemble a cross between a spider and an eel. They have eight limbs and their bodies are covered in a light fur, usually tan or other shades of brown. Neogi are enslavers, often relying on mental control of Umber Hulks for many of their physical demands.
Though the Neogi are physically weak and tend to prefer relying on their natural psionic abilities, a few choose a different path and become reavers or warriors. While not built for battle, they can be surprisingly effective due to their cunning nature.
